intro: Sommera dunlapii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed capsules that disperse its seeds via the wind. Sommera dunlapii is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
